author: CBC News
title: Province makes changes to Employment Standards Act to help workers during coronavirus crisis
description: The changes include workers being able to take unpaid, job-protected leave if they're unable to work for COVID-19-related reasons and take up to three days of unpaid, job-protected leave each year for people who cannot work due to illness or injury.
content:
The B.C. government has made two changes to the Employment Standards Act to support workers both during the COVID-19 public health emergency and in the long term.
